primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church (Subject) must respond to the gift of Easter power by adopting specific practices (Object) to demonstrate a new world to a watching, bewildered world (Receiver).

tekstueel_bewijs: the church has not always known how to respond
how the church—people like us—can give daily evidence
Church folk are those who by their lives... give evidence

object.identificatie: Ethical evidence/witness of the 'New World' (Neighborliness, Justice, Truth-telling)
tekstueel_bewijs: give daily evidence that we are different people
a new world of generosity and forgiveness
the task of contributing to the well-being of the whole body

zender.identificatie: The Biblical Texts / The Lectionary / The Preacher
tekstueel_bewijs: the counsel of these texts seems to me useful
the Bible is filled with counsel, advice, and urging
So here is the counsel I read in these texts
the world, in its bewilderment, is watching

helper.identificatie: Jesus (as a model or immediate provider of speech)
tekstueel_bewijs: the newness of Jesus that he acted out before our very eyes
I will give you words and a wisdom

tegenstander.identificatie: The 'Old World' / Self-preoccupation / Chattering / Status Quo
tekstueel_bewijs: the old world of greed and fear
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily a set of bad habits or social attitudes (greed, fear, idle talk) rather than an ontological or cosmic power that the Subject cannot overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God (Subject) creates a new heaven and earth (Object) for humanity (Receiver).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (human action) is presented as the 'response' or 'evidence' of this secondary program, but the sermon's weight is on the human performance of the response.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Biblical Counsel → Ethical Witness → The Bewildered World
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: The Church → Evidence of New Life

voorbeelden_god_subject: God’s Easter power for life is loose
voorbeelden_mens_subject: you will surely get into trouble

voorbeelden: the summons is how the church... can give daily evidence
everyone needs to be at the witness
take heart, and live in joy
the church has not always known how to respond
the counsel of these texts seems to me useful
God’s capacity to bring life out of death

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon assumes the 'Pouvoir' (Power) is already 'loose' in the world, therefore the focus shifts entirely to the 'Devoir' (Obligation) and 'Savoir' (Knowledge) of the church to enact it.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Old World) to ~S1 (Idleness) to S1 (New World via human contribution).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is achieved through the 'practices of discipleship'—human action bridges the gap.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; S2 is seen as a 'failed' world that is 'baffled', rather than a dead-end of sin requiring rescue.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While using the vocabulary of 'Easter power' and 'God's promise,' the actantial subject is consistently the church. God is the provider of the 'power' (fuel), but the church is the 'engine' and the driver. The sermon is a series of imperatives (Contribute, Watch, Live).

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The summons is how the church... can give daily evidence that we are different people.
Everyone in the church has a calling to that... the world is watching to see if the case can be made.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: It will come because God will give it, and will not stop until all is well.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is presented as the one who 'acted out' the new world for us to 'slant our lives toward.'
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Instead of 'slanting our lives toward Jesus' action,' the sermon could emphasize Jesus slanting his life toward us in our inability.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform; sense of responsibility for the 'success' of the New World.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is functionally 'Moral Influence'—we are moved by the vision to act.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is logically coherent as a call to action, but theologically strained between 'God gives it' and 'We must enact it.'
spanning_punten: The power is 'loose' (Passive) vs 'Everybody has to contribute' (Active).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: This means to slant one’s life toward the newness of Jesus that he acted out before our very eyes.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is replaced by 'Easter power' which functions as a resource for the human subject.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is described as 'idleness,' 'chattering,' and 'greed'—behaviors to be corrected by 'discipline' and 'summons'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a recruitment speech. The Church is the Subject, and God is the Helper/Sender. This creates a 'Grammar of Law' where the Gospel is a resource for human improvement.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The church is the subject of 'giving evidence' and 'making the case.'
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the Subject of the transformation.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We must give evidence,' use 'The Spirit produces evidence in us.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Contributor' to God's world.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the hearer's bankruptcy before the 'Old World' and God's unilateral rescue.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the 'Easter power' actually overcomes the human inability to stop 'chattering'.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Describe the 'Old World' as a power that holds us captive, which we cannot simply 'decide' to leave.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Without a strong opponent, grace is merely 'advice'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Establish God's completed work in Christ as the only reason for the church's existence before asking for contribution.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a strong social vision but lacks the 'theocentric engine' to sustain it without exhausting the congregation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would praise the clear three-point structure; Greimas reveals that all three points have the same anthropocentric subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might confirm the 'work' in 2 Thess, but semiotics shows the sermon uses this to build a system of 'merit-based witness'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that 'Jesus' is used as a Helper (instrument) rather than the Subject (Saviour) of the verbs.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Liberal Moralism' where the Gospel is reduced to a social alternative enacted by human effort.
